colonies: The colonies of the Spanish-American colonies were the territories of Spain that had been established by the king Ferdinand II of Castile and León in 1511.
british army: The British Army was the British military force in the American Revolutionary War.
constitution: The constitution of the United States of America was adopted by the Massachusetts Bay Colony in 1671.
taxation: Taxation was the main issue of the American Revolution.
taxation without representation: Taxation without representation was the practice of the British Crown in the American colonies from the late 17th century to the early 18th.
representation: Representation is the process by which the people of the United States elect representatives to the national legislature.
